name: Andreas Kaminski
title: PD Dr. phil. (visiting Professor)
cv: Andreas Kaminski is a visiting professor (since May 2021 until 2025) at the chair of Prof. Dr. Gabriele Gramelsberger (Theory of Science and Technology). He is head of the Department of Philosophy of Science and Technology at the Federal High-Performance Computing Center at the University of Stuttgart (HLRS). Andreas Kaminski habilitated at the University of Marburg and received his doctorate at the TU Darmstadt. He is co-founder of the Jahrbuch Technikphilosophie, was speaker of the DFG network 'Geschichte der Prüfungstechniken 1900-2000'. He is a member of the expert group on 'Trusted Information' at the EU Observatory for ICT Standards (EUOS) and of the AI Ethics Impact Group, which developed a novel standardization for AI. Kaminski's research areas are: 1. Philosophy of science and technology. What role does (information) technology play in the acquisition of knowledge? 2. Epistemology of testimony and philosophy of trust: What role do trust and communities play in the acquisition of knowledge? 3. History of psychometry: How do psychometric tests affect self- and social relationship?
researchInterests: Philosophy of Science and Technology; Epistemology; History of Psychometry; Phenomenology
